txt.en: The Wose looks up and hands you a mysterious object of intricate stonework. You are not sure how anyone could create something so detailed out of stone so quickly.
Ghâr-buri-Bhâm is in Drû Bhûta.\n\nYou should speak with Ghâr-buri-Bhâm about the ward.
Ghâr-buri-Bhâm is in Drû Bhûta.\n\nYou should wait for Ghâr-buri-Bhâm to craft the ward.
Ward pieces can be found near Púkel-men statues in the Drúadan Forest.\n\nYou should collect ward pieces for the Woses.
Ghân-buri-Ghân can be found in Drû Bhûta.\n\nYou should speak with Ghân-buri-Ghân.
Ghâr-buri-Bhâm is in Drû Bhûta.\n\nYou should bring the ward pieces to Ghâr-buri-Bhâm so that he can craft a new ward for the village.
'Ghâr-buri-Bhâm has made a Okwô-kuryô heart. I see this. I have good words. Rhûd-pulo-Drât has returned to Drû Bhûta. The heart draws him a line to safety of the village.'
Bring the ward pieces to Ghâr-buri-Bhâm
Ghân-buri-Ghân, chieftain of the Drúedain, asks of you to help collect ward fragments from Púkel-men statues so that the Woses may protect themselves from this new threat.
Wait for Ghâr-buri-Bhâm to craft the ward
You hand the fragments to Ghâr-buri-Bhâm. His expression remains serious and he begins to tinker away with bits of stone.

'The Okwô-kuryô protect us. Once Okwô-kuryô breaks, no longer watches over Drúedain. Drúedain can rebuild Okwô-kuryô. First we must make new heart for Okwô-kuryô. You get Okwô-kuryô fragments, bring them to Ghâr-buri-Bhâm. He make Okwô-kuryô heart.'
It seems that Ghâr-buri-Bhâm has finished working with the Púkel-men statue fragments you gave him
